summary: oh yeah i watched fantastic beasts 2 last night and i actually thought it was much better than the first one tbh. like the main...
body: oh yeah i watched fantastic beasts 2 last night and i actually thought it was much better than the first one tbh. like the main four are still pointless especially newt but the plot was much more interesting (mainly the leta/credence stuff, and also omg seeing hogwarts again ;_;) and the worldbuilding was good. johnny depp’s cracked out ass brought nothing to the role of grindelwald though like THIS domestic abuser’s performance is the hill you decided to die on jk and co? anyway i’m glad it flopped

reblog.comment: oh yeah i watched fantastic beasts 2 last night and i actually thought it was much better than the first one tbh. like the main four are still pointless especially newt but the plot was much more interesting (mainly the leta/credence stuff, and also omg seeing hogwarts again ;_;) and the worldbuilding was good. johnny depp’s cracked out ass brought nothing to the role of grindelwald though like THIS domestic abuser’s performance is the hill you decided to die on jk and co? anyway i’m glad it flopped

summary: happy valentine’s! could u continue the one about harry being able to recognise fred and george pls? thank you!
question: happy valentine’s! could u continue the one about harry being able to recognise fred and george pls? thank you!
answer:
a continuation of 1 2 3 4 5 6

Charlie is expecting it when Ron comes pestering him for advice about how to deal with dragons. He and Harry might be fighting, but he’s still Ron’s best friend. No matter how upset Ron is, he won’t want Harry to go in blind. 

He’s careful only to give Ron information that’s available in the school library, just in case, because he wants to help his little brother out, but he doesn’t want to lose his job. 

What he’s not expecting is Fred and George at his door, pale and oddly serious. “We can’t let anything happen to Harry,” says Fred - or George - fuck, the one on the left. 

“Tell us everything,” demands the twin on right. 

Fred and George never ask him for anything. 

“Alright,” he sighs.

reblog.comment:
a continuation of 1 2 3 4 5 6

“Tell us everything,” demands the twin on right. 

Fred and George never ask him for anything. 

“Alright,” he sighs.

“Tell us everything,” demands the twin on right.

“Alright,” he sighs.
trail.content:
a continuation of 1 2 3 4 5 6

Charlie is expecting it when Ron comes pestering him for advice about how to deal with dragons. He and Harry might be fighting, but he’s still Ron’s best friend. No matter how upset Ron is, he won’t want Harry to go in blind. 

He’s careful only to give Ron information that’s available in the school library, just in case, because he wants to help his little brother out, but he doesn’t want to lose his job. 

What he’s not expecting is Fred and George at his door, pale and oddly serious. “We can’t let anything happen to Harry,” says Fred - or George - fuck, the one on the left. 

“Tell us everything,” demands the twin on right. 

Fred and George never ask him for anything. 

“Alright,” he sighs.
